text.__SUMMARY__: Loveridge's worm snake (Indotyphlops loveridgei) is a harmless blind snake species endemic to northern India.  No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Etymology: The specific name, loveridgei, is in honor of British herpetologist Arthur Loveridge.
text.Geographic range: It is known only from the type specimen, the type locality for which is uncertain: "probably from North India", and likely from "Ambala or the Kulu Valley".
